intro: Tarenna ogoouensis, commonly known as the African star anise, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are used in traditional medicine for their aromatic properties. Tarenna ogoouensis thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
